pr_title: Test multiple set sizes in testLargeIn

timeline.message:
Test multiple set sizes in testLargeIn

It is possible that connector has mechanisms which ensure that very
large value sets (>5000) work fine, yet it would still fail for smaller,
yet not tiny sets. Adding coverage for that.

timeline.bodyText:
We should be able to enable the test now for memsql.
(make a PR from inside the repo to have memsql tests run)
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText: We should be able to enable the test now for phoenix, provided that @sopel39 's capping works for phoenix too.
timeline.author: findepi

timeline.bodyText:
would it be possible to calc expected values without h2? would that improve test runtime?
like:
assertThat(query("....."))
  .matches( materialized result )

(treat this optional)
timeline.author: findepi

replies.bodyText: I will skip this one. Materialized rows for "not in" are kinda painful.
replies.author: losipiuk
